intro: Cremanthodium potaninii, commonly known as the Tibetan snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, though it is not a true cactus, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to cold, arid environments and has a short growth period during the summer months. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, and it produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom briefly. Cremanthodium potaninii is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to extreme environmental conditions.
